image.altText: A man wearing a green jacket and hat holding tomatoes.

props.synopsis: Tomato growers placed into quarantine after the discovery of the tomato brown rugose virus say authorities should have been better prepared for the arrival of the virus.

title.children: 'Devastated': Tens of millions of dollars in losses smash Australian tomato farmers

image.altText: An older man poses on an armchair with one leg crossed over the other.

props.synopsis: George Negus's frosty interview with Maragaret Thatcher became famous, but it sparked a flurry of calls between Canberra and London and a demand by the then-British prime minister to have the full interview released without edits.

title.children: From high-school teacher to celebrated journalist. George Negus remembered for his most famous interview

image.altText: Penny Wong wears a maroon blazer as she speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Foreign Minister said she didn't believe "we gain anything by shouting each other down" after being forced to stop her speech multiple times.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protesters shout down Penny Wong as she delivers speech in Tasmania

image.altText: A row of damaged beige tents stands, some without covers, as two women look on from the background

props.synopsis: Israeli military strikes kill at least 40 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip as Israeli forces tighten their squeeze around Jabalia in the north of the enclave, amid fierce battles with Hamas-led fighters.

title.children: 40 Palestinians killed in one day as UN says Israel 'cutting off northern Gaza completely'

image.altText: A room with ocean views.

props.synopsis: The Copacabana property on the NSW Central Coast is touted as being "clifftop perfection" and features expansive ocean views.

title.children: 'I earn a good income': Albanese buys $4.3 million clifftop property to be close to future wife's family

image.altText: Cameron Burgess  lies on the pitch

props.synopsis: The Socceroos took the lead thanks to an own goal, but were then pegged back by one of their own as they battled to a 1-1 draw against Japan in Saitama.

title.children: Socceroos held to valiant draw by Japan in Saitama

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the estranged wife of ex-AFL star Ricky Olarenshaw claims his client is the victim of dodgy police work, exploitation, and threats by another Australian man to bring in "very powerful people."

title.children: Allegations of threats and wads of cash emerge in case of Bali sex parlour with alleged links to ex-AFL star

image.altText: George Negus in a brown suit jacket and glasses, shot outdoors in daylight with a blurred background.

props.synopsis: Veteran journalist and broadcaster George Negus has died at the age of 82, his family said in a statement.

title.children: 'Larger than life': Pioneering broadcaster George Negus dead at 82

image.altText: A woman in a white long-sleeve and collared shirt with shoulder-length black hair sits behind a desk

props.synopsis: In the tightly-controlled world of K-pop, the public airing of complaints is rare, with a boardroom drama continuing to play out that could affect the future of one of its most successful bands.

title.children: Hanni of NewJeans speaks about bullying and harassment in K-pop industry

image.altText: Two small boats with divers abroad approach a large underwater shipwreck

props.synopsis: New Zealand's defence minister has dismissed calls for an apology, saying the NZ Defence Force was "deeply traumatised" by the sinking of HMNZS Manawanui.

title.children: 'Nothing but sadness' in the village near where a NZ Navy ship sank as locals lose livelihoods

image.altText: People watch a TV screen with smoke rising out of a forest area.

props.synopsis: North Korea blows up the north section of unused roads once linked to the South, with the rivals exchanging threats days after the North claimed that its rival flew drones over its capital, Pyongyang.

title.children: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean roads and rails

image.altText: A closeup of stethoscope resting on a doctor's chest.

props.synopsis: Doctors from the UK, Ireland and New Zealand will have their ability to practise in Australia fast-tracked from next week, but the Royal Australian College of General Practitioners says the move lacks detail and could put patients at risk.

title.children: Foreign doctors from select countries will have applications fast tracked under new rules

image.altText: A low angle of Kamala Harris speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Presidential candidate Kamala Harris has told supporters a second Donald Trump term would have "brutally serious" consequences after the former president made ominous comments about an "enemy within".

title.children: Kamala Harris brands Donald Trump a 'risk for America' over 'enemy within' comments

image.altText: Two men at a table with a crowd of people behind them

props.synopsis: Stuart McCullough was paid almost $500,000 from the taxpayer and farmer-funded Australian Wool Innovation organisation to leave his job. WoolProducers has questioned the payout as farmers do it "exceptionally tough".

title.children: Former ag boss receives $480k payout to leave job as farmers do it 'exceptionally tough'

props.synopsis: Mental health, technology and artificial intelligence (AI): Here's what hundreds of students, parents and teachers are most concerned about when it comes to education.

title.children: 'This will break the community': Hundreds of students, parents and teachers told us what's wrong with our schools

image.altText: A man in an army outfit with a blue outfit with a blue UN flag flying beside him.

props.synopsis: At least five peacekeepers have been wounded in a series of strikes that hit peacekeeping positions in Lebanon, but why are peacekeepers there in the first place? Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Why are UN peacekeepers operating in Lebanon?

image.altText: Woman smiling

props.synopsis: The federal government has committed $5.4 million to a pilot program allowing 500 eligible households in Thirroul to purchase electric appliances, heating and cooling systems and home batteries.

title.children: The suburb where locals will be paid up to $10k to go electric

image.altText: Penny Wong stands behind a United Nations lecturn.

props.synopsis: Australia has placed financial sanctions and travel bans on five Iranians with connections to the country's missile program, a fortnight after Iran launched a missile attack against Israel.

title.children: Sanctions placed on five Iranians linked to missile program as Australians warned 'do not travel' to Israel

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White will face a jury trial in November after he pleaded not guilty over the death of the great-grandmother who was tasered in a Snowy Mountains nursing home in 2023.

title.children: NSW police officer to face jury trial over taser death of 95yo old Clare Nowland

image.altText: Hainsworth

props.synopsis: A five-hour police interview with accused serial killer Steven Hainsworth reveals his DNA was found at the scene of his aunt's murder and that he pawned some of her belongings within hours of her death.

title.children: Police grill alleged triple murderer in recorded interview

image.altText: Mitch Moses passing the ball to his left during rugby league training for Australia

props.synopsis: In the first Test match for Australia since being defeated 30-0 by New Zealand last year, the Kangaroos will have an all-new halves pairing on Friday night.

title.children: Kangaroos unveil new halves as Meninga names six debutants for Tonga Test

image.altText: Headshot of elderly woman with green jacket and red lipstick wearing pearls

props.synopsis: Lilly Ledbetter launched a lawsuit when she discovered she was being paid less than her male co-workers. She never saw a dime of the money she was owed, but It made her an icon in the fight for women's rights in the workplace.

title.children: Lily Ledbetter was owed millions in back pay by her employer. She became an equal pay trailblazer

image.altText: Vladimir Putin sits in a seat thinking while wearing a dark suit.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the death of a British woman from Novichok in 2018 hears allegations Russian President Vladimir Putin approved the delivery of the lethal nerve agent to the UK for the poisoning of former Russian spy Sergei Skripal.

title.children: Fake perfume bottle Russia allegedly used to poison ex-spy in UK contained enough nerve agent to kill thousands

image.altText: Esmail Qaani speaking into a microphone on a black background.

props.synopsis: Rumours about Esmail Qaani's whereabouts have been swirling for weeks — now Iranian TV has aired what it says is footage of him alive and well in Tehran. Here's what we know about Qaani and the Quds Force he commands.

title.children: Iranian TV airs footage it says shows top Guard commander at centre of disappearance rumours

image.altText: A drone that looks like an aeroplane flies through the air.

props.synopsis: Drones have changed the face of modern warfare and are being used from Ukraine to the Middle East, but can Australia keep up with the pace when it comes to its national defence strategy?

title.children: What Australia needs to learn from the drones dominating the Ukraine war

image.altText: A figure in high vis orange shirt and hat kneels to pick blueberries with a bucket of berries between their legs.

props.synopsis: The inquiry was a key recommendation from the NSW Anti-Slavery Commissioner, who identified practices including forced labour, possible sexual servitude and emerging labour trafficking.

title.children: Modern slavery claims to be examined amid 'substantial evidence' of migrant workers being exploited in NSW

image.altText: Container full of nicotine pouches

props.synopsis: A survey of young Australians aged 16 to 39 years old finds about 25 per cent have used illegal nicotine pouches. One expert says there needs to be better enforcement of current laws to stop young people from using the products.

title.children: Survey of young Australians finds one in four have used illegal nicotine pouches

image.altText: Beth Mooney drives the ball

props.synopsis: Alyssa Healy remains no certainty to return from a foot injury for the Twenty20 World Cup semifinal and final, making Beth Mooney's role at the top crucial.

title.children: Why big-game specialist Mooney can cover Healy void

image.altText: A streak of white among a purple sky above green grass at night

props.synopsis: The phenomenon is not well understood, and an astrophysicist says it is hard to predict when and where Steve will appear next.

title.children: Photographers looking for Aurora Australis capture mysterious phenomenon Steve instead

image.altText: People in a packed moshpit inside a tent with giant balloons put their hands up as a person on stage jumps up in the air.

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents reveal tens of millions of dollars in grants were given to global behemoth Live Nation at a time when Australia's music industry was struggling.

title.children: Music giant Live Nation earned $US23 billion last year. Australian governments have been giving it millions in grants

image.altText: 24 NRL players in red/yellow or blue/green pose all together on a football pitch in front of stands filled with people

props.synopsis: The prime minister has refused to say what security guarantees Australia wants from Papua New Guinea in return for backing the Pacific country's bid for an NRL team.

title.children: Albanese silent on security demands as Australia backs PNG's $600m NRL bid

image.altText: Classroom chair knocked over

props.synopsis: Arduous paperwork, surveillance and bullying from management are among the challenges teachers say they face amid a nationwide education staff shortage.

title.children: Kids stabbed with pencils, racist slurs: Student behaviour a growing concern as schools battle teacher shortages

image.altText: Tim Tszyu smiles in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu insists he is "levels above" IBF junior middleweight world champion Bakhram Murtazaliev, and will prove it in Orlando on Sunday.

title.children: 'I'm levels above': Tim Tszyu dismisses claims he is 'overhyped' ahead of Orlando world title fight

image.altText: Cooper Hamilton

props.synopsis: One minute Cooper Hamilton was on an AFL list and chasing his dream. The next, he was writing 'unemployed' on a hospital form, in a scene that is incredibly familiar for professional footballers.

title.children: 'Dagger in the heart': What it's like to be told you won't receive another AFL contract
